intro: Lastrea novaeana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. It is often used in traditional Māori weaving and has cultural significance in New Zealand. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and resilience in different environmental conditions.
